title: The Missing Office Plant
setting: Maplewood Insurance, reception area, Monday 9 AM
premise: Gerald the beloved office ficus tree vanished from the reception area over the weekend. Gerald has been the office mascot for eight years. Security cameras were down for maintenance Saturday.

suspects.name: Patty Lockwood
suspects.motive: Complained that Gerald was attracting gnats near her desk
suspects.alibi: I was at my sister's lake cabin in Pine Ridge all weekend from Friday evening to Sunday night. We had no cell service out there.

suspects.name: Martin Hull
suspects.motive: Wanted the corner where Gerald sits for a new display shelf
suspects.alibi: I came into the office Saturday morning around 10 to catch up on paperwork. I worked at my desk on the third floor until about 2 PM.

suspects.name: Yolanda Reese
suspects.motive: Allergic to the fertilizer used on Gerald and asked for it to be removed twice
suspects.alibi: I was home all weekend doing spring cleaning. My neighbor came over and helped me move furniture on Saturday afternoon. I never left my apartment at all.

suspects.name: Dean Kowalski
suspects.motive: Gerald's falling leaves create extra cleanup work every single day
suspects.alibi: I did my regular Saturday evening cleaning shift from 5 PM to 9 PM. I cleaned all four floors starting from the top like always.

clues.title: Soil Trail
clues.content: Small traces of potting soil were found leading from the reception area to the service elevator, then to the loading dock at the back of the building.

clues.title: Building Sign-In Sheet
clues.content: The weekend sign-in log shows Martin signed in Saturday at 10:05 AM and out at 2:10 PM. Dean signed in at 5:00 PM and out at 9:05 PM. No one else signed in all weekend.

clues.title: Neighbor's Testimony
clues.content: Yolanda's neighbor confirms helping her move furniture Saturday from 1 PM to 4 PM. But the neighbor also saw Yolanda leaving her apartment building with car keys at 8 AM Saturday morning.
